title: How to Make a White Chocolate Mousse With Berries

steps.headline: Heat a saucepan over medium heat.
steps.description: Add the cream to the saucepan and bring it to a simmer. When it begins to simmer, remove it from the heat and pour it into a mixing bowl. Add the white chocolate to the bowl and mix them together with a whisk.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/64\/Mousse_berries_2_404.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/64\/Mousse_berries_2_404.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Place the mixing bowl in the refrigerator. Chill the mixture for at least 4 hours.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/43\/Mousse_berries_3_437.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/43\/Mousse_berries_3_437.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":340,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":562.4,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Pre-heat the oven to 392 degrees F, 200 degrees C, or gas mark 7.

steps.headline: Make the filo pastry.
Place the metal cups onto the baking tray upside down.
steps.description: Fit and mould the filo pieces onto each metal cup, being careful of not tearing the pastry.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/40\/Mousse_berries_9_575.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/40\/Mousse_berries_9_575.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Bake the pastry for 5 to 7 minutes.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f0\/Mousse_berries_10_260.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f0\/Mousse_berries_10_260.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Remove the pastry from the cups in a gentle way. They will crack if you're not careful of handling them.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/99\/Mousse_berries_11_710.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/99\/Mousse_berries_11_710.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"}
steps.description: Whip the mousse until the consistency becomes a velvety mousse. Make sure not to over-whip, as the mixture will curdle.

steps.headline: Fill the filo pastries with the mousse.
steps.description: Garnish it with fresh berries and sprinkle it with powdered sugar. Serve and enjoy.

text:
Heat a saucepan over medium heat. Add the cream to the saucepan and bring it to a simmer. When it begins to simmer, remove it from the heat and pour it into a mixing bowl. Add the white chocolate to the bowl and mix them together with a whisk. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/64/Mousse_berries_2_404.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/64/Mousse_berries_2_404.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Place the mixing bowl in the refrigerator. Chill the mixture for at least 4 hours. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/43/Mousse_berries_3_437.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/43/Mousse_berries_3_437.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":340,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":562.4,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Pre-heat the oven to 392 degrees F, 200 degrees C, or gas mark 7. Make the filo pastry. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/91/Mousse_berries_4_67.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/91/Mousse_berries_4_67.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":342,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":564.9333333333333,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Place a sheet of filo pastry on the cutting board. Brush and cover the pastry sheet with butter. Sprinkle some powdered sugar on the pastry sheet and then cover it with another pastry sheet. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a3/Mousse_berries_5_358.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/a/a3/Mousse_berries_5_358.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":338,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":559.1022443890274,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Flatten the second pastry sheet on the first one by smoothing it down with your hand. Repeat the process with the other sheets. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/ba/Mousse_berries_6_666.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/ba/Mousse_berries_6_666.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Brush the last sheet with butter, sprinkle it with powdered sugar, and turn them all over, exposing the side that was against the cutting board. Now butter and sugar this side as well. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/64/Mousse_berries_7_229.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/64/Mousse_berries_7_229.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Cut the pastry sheets in half along its length. Make the edges nice and even by trimming them off. Cut the filo into six squares. Place the metal cups onto the baking tray upside down. Fit and mould the filo pieces onto each metal cup, being careful of not tearing the pastry. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/40/Mousse_berries_9_575.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/4/40/Mousse_berries_9_575.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Bake the pastry for 5 to 7 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f0/Mousse_berries_10_260.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/f/f0/Mousse_berries_10_260.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Remove the pastry from the cups in a gentle way. They will crack if you're not careful of handling them. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/99/Mousse_berries_11_710.PNG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/99/Mousse_berries_11_710.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.4666666666667,"licensing":"

http://www.videojug.com/film/how-to-make-white-chocolate-mousse-with-berries - shared with permission

License: Creative Commons

"} Whip the mousse until the consistency becomes a velvety mousse. Make sure not to over-whip, as the mixture will curdle. Fill the filo pastries with the mousse. Garnish it with fresh berries and sprinkle it with powdered sugar. Serve and enjoy.
